name: v0.12.0
body:
## Pkl Rules

[Pkl] is an embeddable configuration language with rich support for data templating and
validation. It can be used from the command line, integrated in a build pipeline, or embedded in a
program. Pkl scales from small to large, simple to complex, ad-hoc to repetitive configuration
tasks.

For further information about Pkl, check out the [official Pkl documentation].

[official Pkl documentation]: https://pkl-lang.org/main/current/index.html
[pkl]: https://pkl-lang.org


## Quick Start

### Setup

To use `rules_pkl`, enable `bzlmod` within your project, and then add the following to your `MODULE.bazel`:

```starlark
# Please check the releases page on GitHub for the latest released version
bazel_dep(name = "rules_pkl", version = "0.12.0")
```

## Examples

See the `examples/` directory for complete examples of how to use `rules_pkl`.

## Ruleset Docs

For further information on the rules provided, check out the [`rules_pkl` documentation].

[`rules_pkl` documentation]: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/blob/main/docs/rules_pkl_docs.md

## What's Changed

* Clean up BCR configuration to remove `patches` by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/100
* Allow overriding default version by @srueg in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/102
* Allow overriding the pkl version in`pkl_package` by @sitaktif in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/101
* Support junit xml output for pkl test by @gordonbondon in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/93
* Drop support for < 0.29 versions by @gordonbondon in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/104
* build: update rules_bazel_integration_test Bazel dep by @sitaktif in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/105
* build: add a //:buildifier-fix target by @sitaktif in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/106
* Bump module to 0.12.0 by @sitaktif in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/103


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/compare/v0.11.1...v0.12.0

body:
## Pkl Rules

[Pkl] is an embeddable configuration language with rich support for data templating and
validation. It can be used from the command line, integrated in a build pipeline, or embedded in a
program. Pkl scales from small to large, simple to complex, ad-hoc to repetitive configuration
tasks.

For further information about Pkl, check out the [official Pkl documentation].

[official Pkl documentation]: https://pkl-lang.org/main/current/index.html
[pkl]: https://pkl-lang.org


## Quick Start

### Setup

To use `rules_pkl`, enable `bzlmod` within your project, and then add the following to your `MODULE.bazel`:

```starlark
# Please check the releases page on GitHub for the latest released version
bazel_dep(name = "rules_pkl", version = "0.8.0")
```

## Examples

See the `examples/` directory for complete examples of how to use `rules_pkl`.

## Ruleset Docs

For further information on the rules provided, check out the [`rules_pkl` documentation].

[`rules_pkl` documentation]: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/blob/main/docs/rules_pkl_docs.md

## What's Changed

* Update `.bazelversion` to 7.6.1 by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/74
* Fix: extension pkl reported incorrect imports of repositories by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/75
* Remove `github-release` workflow by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/76
* Update `bazel_dep` versions in preparation for Bazel 8.x by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/77
* Provide an `alias` to access the default `pkl` binary with by @shs96c in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/79
* Integration test against Bazel 7 and Bazel 8; resolve paths as `short_path` for binaries and tests by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/78
* Allow configuring targets not use a cache `--no-cache` by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/80
* Update version to `0.8.0` by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/81


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/compare/v0.7.0...v0.8.0

name: v0.4.0
body:
## Pkl Rules

[Pkl] is an embeddable configuration language with rich support for data templating and
validation. It can be used from the command line, integrated in a build pipeline, or embedded in a
program. Pkl scales from small to large, simple to complex, ad-hoc to repetitive configuration
tasks.

For further information about Pkl, check out the [official Pkl documentation].

[official Pkl documentation]: https://pkl-lang.org/main/current/index.html
[pkl]: https://pkl-lang.org


## Quick Start

### Setup

To use `rules_pkl`, enable `bzlmod` within your project, and then add the following to your `MODULE.bazel`:

```starlark
# Please check the releases page on GitHub for the latest released version
bazel_dep(name = "rules_pkl", version = "0.4.0")
```

## Examples

See the `examples/` directory for complete examples of how to use `rules_pkl`.

## Ruleset Docs

For further information on the rules provided, check out the [`rules_pkl` documentation].

[`rules_pkl` documentation]: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/blob/main/docs/rules_pkl_docs.md

## What's Changed

* Make sure that all `.bazelversion` files are consistent by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/46
* Test that `bazel_binaries.download` matches `.bazelversion` by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/47
* `pkl_eval` uses the `short_path` for `entrypoints` files by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/48
* Add directories to `.bazelignore` so `bazel build //...` works by @shs96c in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/49
* Move the extension to the location recommend by the Bazel devs by @shs96c in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/50
* Update `.bazelversion` to 7.4.1 by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/52
* [circleci]: Store bazel cache information, alongside the test logs by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/53
* Rename all Java code generation rules to be prefixed with `pkl_java_` by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/51
* Add Pkl 0.27.2 and make it the default version by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/54
* Run `gazelle` and make sure all changes are committed by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/55
* Update `aspect_bazel_lib` to 2.13.0 by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/56
* Update `gazelle` to 0.36.0 by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/57
* Test that the module's `version` matches that of the README.md by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/58
* Update the `version` to 0.4.0 by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/59


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/compare/v0.3.0...v0.4.0

name: v0.3.0
body:
## Pkl Rules

[Pkl] is an embeddable configuration language with rich support for data templating and
validation. It can be used from the command line, integrated in a build pipeline, or embedded in a
program. Pkl scales from small to large, simple to complex, ad-hoc to repetitive configuration
tasks.

For further information about Pkl, check out the [official Pkl documentation].

## Quick Start

### Setup


## Examples

See the `examples/` directory for complete examples of how to use `rules_pkl`.

## Ruleset Docs

For further information on the rules provided, check out the [`rules_pkl` documentation].

[`rules_pkl` documentation]: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/blob/main/docs/rules_pkl_docs.md

## What's Changed
* feat: add to extra_flags & environment attributes to pkl_project rule by @asalah33 in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/26
* Replace `runfiles` based Python tests with Java tests by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/41
* buildifier: ignore `.git` and `.ijwb` directories by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/42
* Add Pkl 0.27.1 and make it the default version by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/44
* Update deps: `aspect_bazel_lib` (2.10.0), `bazel_skylib_gazelle_plugin` (1.7.1), `buildifier_prebuilt` (7.3.1), `rules_bazel_integration_test` (0.29.0) by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/43
* Update version number to 0.3.0 by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/45

## New Contributors
* @asalah33 made their first contribution in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/26

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/compare/v0.2.0...v0.3.0

name: v0.2.0
body:
## Pkl Rules

[Pkl] is an embeddable configuration language with rich support for data templating and
validation. It can be used from the command line, integrated in a build pipeline, or embedded in a
program. Pkl scales from small to large, simple to complex, ad-hoc to repetitive configuration
tasks.

For further information about Pkl, check out the [official Pkl documentation].

[official Pkl documentation]: https://pkl-lang.org/main/current/index.html
[pkl]: https://pkl-lang.org


## Quick Start

### Setup

To use `rules_pkl`, enable `bzlmod` within your project, and then add the following to your `MODULE.bazel`:

```starlark
# Please check the releases page on GitHub for the latest released version
bazel_dep(name = "rules_pkl", version = "0.2.0")
```

## Examples

See the `examples/` directory for complete examples of how to use `rules_pkl`.

## Ruleset Docs
For further information on the rules provided, check out the [`rules_pkl` documentation].

[`rules_pkl` documentation]: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/blob/main/docs/rules_pkl_docs.md

## What's Changed
* Add Pkl 0.27.0 and make it the default version by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/25
* Extract how we produce cache directories and inputs to a helper by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/6
* Change `outs` from `string_list` to `output_list` by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/10
* Stop using `org.pkl-lang:pkl-cli-java`, use `org.pkl-lang:pkl-tools` instead by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/14
* Update `mnemonic` in use for `pkl_eval` to `PklEval` by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/20
* feat: add pkl_package rule by @francine-blanc in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/16
* Fix empty output by @srueg in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/22
* Use `pkl-tools` instead of `pkl-doc` to drive `org.pkl.doc.Main` by @KushalP in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/27
* Make the pkl toolchain type public so people can declare their own toolchains by @shs96c in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/28
* Add Pkl `codegen` related macros by @shs96c in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/30
* Fixes to get `rules_pkl` to pass for larger projects by @shs96c in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/31

## New Contributors
* @shs96c made their first contribution in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/3
* @KushalP made their first contribution in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/5
* @sitaktif made their first contribution in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/13
* @francine-blanc made their first contribution in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/16
* @srueg made their first contribution in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/22
* @stevebarrau made their first contribution in https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/pull/29

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/apple/rules_pkl/compare/v0.1.0...v0.2.0
